Chris,

What problems do you actually see here (or your open source office)=
?  JUnit is out there over six or seven years and it is integrated in all t=
he major IDEs and used in countless commercial projects.  It is hard to bel=
ieve that there should be any licensing problems.

Andreas

=
company for some product testing. However, our open source office is 
very =
concerned about the IBM Common Public License and its 
applicability to=A0 =
users and distributors of Junit and possible patent 
infringements.

nyone comment on this concern ? If Kent or Erich are listening, 
can Junit =
by licensed under an alternate open-source or=A0 
commercial license ?
